subject: A couple of replies...
msgSnippet: First, on the Map v. HashMap v. Hashtable issue, let me say that I agree with the existing replies. Let me add, however, that one should code to the Map
messageBody:
First, on the Map v. HashMap v. Hashtable issue, let me say that I agree
with the existing replies. Let me add, however, that one should code to the
Map interface and not to the particular implementation. In other words, I
hope to see

Map aMap = new HashMap();

and not

HashMap aHashMap = new HashMap();

which is more resistant to change than the first example.

======================

Also, there's the issue of whether there should be one failure or many when
one attempts to test failed parameter validation in an input form. Again, I
agree with the proposed strategy, and underscore that whether it is 'n'
failures or 1 failure is probably not important. You may simply wish to
write a test that, rather than using classic asserts, collects the names of
the failed parameters. Then, assertTrue(failedParameterNames.isEmpty()).

Thanks, everyone. Hope this helps.

JBR.
